gurmukhi: qb AjIq isMG Awp hI DwXo ]DnK bwn lY rn miD AwXo ]BUpiq ko iqn bcn sunwXo ]qo bD ihq iSv muih aupjwXo ]1669]
transliteration: Tab Ajeet Singh Aap Hidhaayo|| Dhanakh Baan Lai Ran Madh(i) Aayo|| Bhoopat(i) Ko Tin Bachanndsounaayo|| To Badh Hit Shiv Muh(i) Oupjaayo||1669||
translation: Then Ajit Singh himself took his bow and arrows and reached the war-arena; he said to the king, “Shiva has created me only for the purpose of killing you.”1669.

gurmukhi: AjIq isMG XoN bcn aucwrXo ]KVg isMG rn mwih hkwrXo ]niRp ey bYn sunq nhI frXo ]mhwNbIr pgu AwgY DrXo ]1670]
transliteration: Ajeet Singh Yon Bachanndouchdaryo|| Khadag Singh Ran Maah(i) Hakdaryo|| Nrip E Bain Sounat Nahidaryo|| Mahaanbeer Pag(u) Aagad Ddaryo||1670||
translation: Ajit Singh saying like this, challenged Kharag Singh for fighting; the king was not frightened on listening this and that mighty one came forward.1670.

gurmukhi: AjIq isMG r`Cw ihq Dwey ]gXwrh rudR Bwn sB Awey ]ieMdR ikSn jm bsu irs Bry ]bwrn kubyr Gyr sB Kry ]1671]
transliteration: Ajeet Singh Rachchhaadhit Dhaae|| Gyaarah Rudra Bhaan Sabh Aae|| Indra Kishan Jam Bas(u) Ris Bhare|| Baran Kouber Gher Sabh Kdare||1671||
translation: The eleven Rudras and Surya reached there fore the protection of Ajit Singh; Indra, Krishna, Yama, Varuna, Kuber etc., all had surrounded him.1671.

gurmukhi: isMG AjIq jbY KVgyS so sXwm khY Aiq ju`Du mcwXo ]sMg iSvwidk sUr ijqy Air mwrn ko iqh hwQ aucwXo ]
transliteration: Singh Ajeet Jabai Khadgesh So Syaam Kahai At(i) Juddh(u) Mahaayo|| San Shivaadik Soor Jite Ar(i) Maaran Ko Tih Haath Ouchadyo||
translation: When Ajit Singh waged a dreadful war with Kharag Singh, then all his accompanying mighty warriors like Shiva etc., held out their weapons in order to kill the enemy;

gurmukhi: bwn cly Aiq hI rn mY niRp kwit sBY mn ros qcwXo ]lY Dnu bwn mhw blvwn hnXo Bt ko iknhUM n bcwXo ]1672]
transliteration: Baan Chale At(i) Hiran Mai Nrip Kaattee Sabhai Man Ros Tachadyo|| Lai Dhan(u) Baan Mahaa Balvaan Hanyo Bhat Ko Kinhoon Na Bachadyo||1672||
translation: The arrows were showered in the battlefield, but the king, in his fury, intercepted all the arrows; that mighty warrior, taking his bow and arrows did not leave anyone and killed all the warriors.1672.

gurmukhi: jb AjIq isMG mwr igrwXo ]suBtn mn BtikE fr pwXo ]bhuro BUpq KVg sMBwrXo ]ckRq BY sBhU blu hwrXo ]1673]
transliteration: Jab Ajeet Singh Maar Giraayo|| Soubhatan Man Bhatkio Dar Paayo|| Bahuro Bhoopat Khadag Sanbhdaryo|| Chakrat Bhe Sabh-hoo Bal(u) Hdaryo||1673||
translation: When Ajit Singh killed the warriors, then the other warriors became fearful in their minds, the king again held out his sword, all the people were wonder-struck by his warfare and lost their valour.1673.

gurmukhi: qb hir hir ibD mMqR ibcwrXo ]mrY n jrY Agn qy jwrXo ]qw qy jqn kCU Ab kIjY ]Xw qy mwr BUp ieh lIjY ]1674]
transliteration: Tab Har(i) Har(i) Bidh Mantra Bichdaryo|| Darai Na Darai Agad Te Jdaryo|| Taa Te Jatan Kachhodh Ab Keejai|| Yaa Te Maar Bhoop Eh Leejai||1674||
translation: Then Krishna and Brahma consulted each other and said, “This king will not even be killed by the blazing fire, therefore making some effort, he should be killed.”1674.

gurmukhi: bHmy khXo su ieh ibD kIjY ]moihq hY mn qb bl CIjY ]jb ieh BUp igirE liK leIXY ]qb ieh jm ky Dwm pTeIXY ]1675]
transliteration: Brahme Kahyo Su Eh Bidh Keejai|| Mohit Hai Man Tab Bal Chheejai|| Jah Eh Bhoop Girio Lakh(i) Laeeyai|| Tab Eh Jam Ke Dhaam Pathaeeyai||1675||
translation: Brahma said, “When he will lose his power by being allured by the heavenly damsels and in this way, when we will see him declining, then he will be despatched to the abode of Yama.1675.

gurmukhi: pun Ap`CRn Awies dIjY ]jw so niRp rIJY soeI kIjY ]kauqk hyr BUp jb lYhY ]Gt jYhY bl mn d?i? jYhY ]1676]
transliteration: Poun Apachchhran Aais Deejai|| Jaa So Nrip Reejhai Soikeejai|| Kaoutak Her Bhoop Jab Laihai|| Ghat Jaihai Bal Man Drav(i) Jaihai||1676||
translation: “Therefore command the heavenly damsels to do that with which the king feels pleased, when the king will be immersed in such a spectacle, his power will decline.”1676.
